qas.question: Where did Ferdinand go rather than Madrid?
How long did absolutist rule last?
Who offered troops to the King?

context: Ferdinand refused and went to <a0_0>Valencia<a0_0/> instead of Madrid. Here, on 17 April, <a4_0>General Elio<a4_0/> invited the King to reclaim his absolute rights and put his troops at the King's disposition. The king abolished the Constitution of <a3_0>1812<a3_0/>. He followed this act by dissolving the two chambers of the Spanish Parliament on 10 May. Thus began <a1_0>six years<a1_0/> (1814–1820) of absolutist rule, but the constitution was reinstated during the Trienio Liberal, a period of three years of liberal government in Spain from <a2_0>1820–1823<a2_0/>.
